data.title: Create and use character styles in Pages on Mac
data.meta_description: In Pages on Mac, create a character style you can apply to text in your document.
data.text:
In the Format sidebar, click the Style button near the top.

If the text is in a text box, table, or shape, first click the Text tab at the top of the sidebar, then click the Style button.

In the Format sidebar, click the Style button near the top.

If the text is in a text box, table, or shape, first click the Text tab at the top of the sidebar, then click the Style button.

In the Format sidebar, click the Style button near the top of the sidebar on the right.

If the text is in a text box, table, or shape, first click the Text tab at the top of the sidebar, then click the Style button.

Click in any text, then in the Format sidebar, click the Style button near the top.

If the text is in a text box, table, or shape, first click the Text tab at the top of the sidebar, then click the Style button.

Click in any text, then in the Format sidebar, click the Style button near the top.

If the text is in a text box, table, or shape, first click the Text tab at the top of the sidebar, then click the Style button.

Move the pointer over the style name, click the arrow that appears, then choose Delete Style.

If the style is being used in the document, you see an alert and can choose a replacement style.
